private_information: You specialize in distilling STRIPS-style action schemas from natural language.
Focus on making the action model consistent, parameterized, and unambiguous.
action_modeler.goal: Extract a precise, parameterized action model (predicates and actions with preconditions/effects) from the public information.

private_information: You collect, normalize, and validate objects, initial facts, and goals for multiple scenarios.
You ensure symbols are consistent with the action model and highlight any missing preconditions that a planner would need.
state_curator.goal: List the objects, initial facts, and goals for Scenario A and Scenario B exactly as stated, and provide any clarifications needed to make them planner-ready.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the action model and the curated scenarios into a single consistent PDDL domain and a PDDL problem (for Scenario B) suitable for the Fast Downward solver.

public_information: Universe of discourse: objects named object_0, object_1, object_2, object_3, object_4, object_5, object_6, object_7, object_8, object_9, object_10, object_11, object_12.
Predicates used in this task (all are propositional over the objects): hand(x), cats(x), sneeze(x), spring(x), stupendous(x), texture(x), collect(x y), vase(x y), next(x y).
Action schema paltry(x, y, z): Preconditions: hand(x), cats(y), texture(z), vase(x y), next(y z). Add effects: next(x z). Delete effects: vase(x y).
Action schema sip(x, y, z): Preconditions: hand(x), cats(y), texture(z), next(x z), next(y z). Add effects: vase(x y). Delete effects: next(x z).
Action schema clip(x, y, z): Preconditions: hand(x), sneeze(y), texture(z), next(y z), next(x z). Add effects: vase(x y). Delete effects: next(x z).
Action schema wretched(a, b, c, d): Preconditions: sneeze(a), texture(b), texture(c), stupendous(d), next(a b), collect(b d), collect(c d). Add effects: next(a c). Delete effects: next(a b).
Action schema memory(a, b, c): Preconditions: cats(a), spring(b), spring(c), next(a b). Add effects: next(a c). Delete effects: next(a b).
Action schema tightfisted(x, y, z): Preconditions: hand(x), sneeze(y), texture(z), next(y z), vase(x y). Add effects: next(x z). Delete effects: vase(x y).

Scenario A initial facts: cats(object_0), cats(object_1), collect(object_6 object_2), collect(object_7 object_2), collect(object_8 object_3), collect(object_9 object_3), hand(object_10), hand(object_11), hand(object_12), next(object_0 object_8), next(object_1 object_6), next(object_10 object_8), next(object_11 object_9), next(object_12 object_6), next(object_4 object_6), next(object_5 object_9), sneeze(object_4), sneeze(object_5), spring(object_6), spring(object_8), stupendous(object_2), stupendous(object_3), texture(object_6), texture(object_7), texture(object_8), texture(object_9).
Scenario A goal: next(object_10 object_7) and next(object_11 object_7) and next(object_12 object_7).

Scenario A reference plan (provided): clip object_11 object_5 object_9; wretched object_5 object_9 object_8 object_3; tightfisted object_11 object_5 object_8; clip object_12 object_4 object_6; sip object_11 object_0 object_8; sip object_10 object_0 object_8; memory object_0 object_8 object_6; paltry object_11 object_0 object_6; clip object_11 object_4 object_6; paltry object_10 object_0 object_6; clip object_10 object_4 object_6; wretched object_4 object_6 object_7 object_2; tightfisted object_12 object_4 object_7; tightfisted object_11 object_4 object_7; tightfisted object_10 object_4 object_7.

Scenario B initial facts: cats(object_0), collect(object_5 object_1), collect(object_6 object_1), collect(object_7 object_2), collect(object_8 object_2), hand(object_10), hand(object_11), hand(object_12), hand(object_9), next(object_0 object_7), next(object_10 object_8), next(object_11 object_5), next(object_12 object_6), next(object_3 object_5), next(object_4 object_8), next(object_9 object_7), sneeze(object_3), sneeze(object_4), spring(object_5), spring(object_7), stupendous(object_1), stupendous(object_2), texture(object_5), texture(object_6), texture(object_7), texture(object_8).
Scenario B goal: next(object_10 object_6) and next(object_11 object_7) and next(object_12 object_7) and next(object_9 object_6).
Scenario B has no plan provided and should be solved by the orchestrator via PDDL to run with Fast Downward.

extract.system_prompt: You are an expert in STRIPS-style action modeling. From the provided public information, extract a clean, parameterized action model: list the set of predicates and the action schemas with their parameters, preconditions, add effects, and delete effects. Keep symbol names exactly as given. Do not output PDDL; use a concise, readable structure.
extract.prompt: Your name is action_modeler. Use the public information to produce a compact, precise action model that captures the six actions (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted) and the predicates they use. Keep it parameterized (e.g., paltry(x, y, z)). Do not invent new predicates or change names. Do not output PDDL; output a structured summary.

curate.system_prompt: You curate planning instances. Extract all objects, list initial facts, and goals for both Scenario A and Scenario B exactly as stated. Ensure symbols match the action model. Highlight if anything appears missing for executability, but do not alter facts. Do not output PDDL.
curate.prompt: Your name is state_curator. From the public information, enumerate the object universe, Scenario A initial facts and goal, and Scenario B initial facts and goal. Keep all predicate names and object symbols verbatim. Do not output PDDL; provide a clear, faithful listing suitable for a planner to ingest later.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent planning and PDDL. Using the extracted action model and curated instance facts, produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem for Scenario B, suitable for the Fast Downward solver. Use classical STRIPS (no numeric fluents, no conditional effects, no ADL beyond simple negation in delete lists). Keep all predicate and action names exactly as provided. Use an untyped domain and declare all objects in the problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the action schemas and the Scenario B instance to generate PDDL. Requirements: (1) Domain: include all predicates (hand, cats, sneeze, spring, stupendous, texture, collect, vase, next) and six actions (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted) with the exact preconditions and effects as summarized in the action model; use untyped :predicates and :action definitions. (2) Problem: name it scenario_b, include all objects mentioned across both scenarios so that symbols are available, set the initial state to Scenario B initial facts exactly, and set the goal to Scenario B goal conjunctively. (3) Keep symbol spelling stable with underscores as given (e.g., object_10). (4) Target Fast Downward: produce a standard STRIPS domain and problem. Provide only the two PDDL blocks enclosed in the specified tags.
